5.1 End all forms of discrimination against women and girls everywhere

Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5.5 Ensure that women participate fully and effectively in leadership functions at all decision-making levels, in political, economic and public life, and have access to them on an equal footing
5.5.1. % of seats held by women in the national parliament
PARLIAMENT AND SENATE
Parliament and Senate website
It is the ratio between the number of seats occupied by women and the total number of seats in Parliament and Senate
Website of the National Assembly and the Senate
Consultation of the bulletin or the Site of the Assembly and the Senet
N / A
N / A
N / A
N / A
N / A
The indicator is relevant because it reflects the texts and laws passed;
The update of the indicator results from the site feed
It is the number of seats held by women out of the total number of seats in Parliament and Senate, multiplied by 100
N / A
Available nationally
N / A

Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

5.6 Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health care and ensure that everyone can exercise their reproductive rights, as decided in the Program of Action of the International Conference on Population and the Beijing Development and Platform for Action and the outcome documents of subsequent review conferences
5.6.1. Population growth rate
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
Head of Service and Focal Point
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
This is the rate of population increase for each year
Demographic projections
Data are from demographic projections
Available nationally

Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

5.6 Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health care and ensure that everyone can exercise their reproductive rights, as decided in the Program of Action of the International Conference on Population and the Beijing Development and Platform for Action and the outcome documents of subsequent review conferences
5.6.2. Average number of children per woman
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
Head of Service and Focal Point
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
This is the average number of children per woman
Number
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator is relevant because it captures the demographic situation.
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator is relevant because it captures the demographic situation.
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

5.a Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control of land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and resources natural, in compliance with internal legislation
5.a.2.Proportion of countries with a legal framework (including customary law) guaranteeing women the same rights as men in terms of access to ownership or control of land
This is to clarify that the country has a legal framework (including customary law) guaranteeing women the same rights as men in terms of access to ownership or control of land.
Affirmation on the existence of the legal framework or not
Not available
Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

5.a Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control of land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and resources natural, in compliance with internal legislation
5.a.2.Proportion of countries with a legal framework (including customary law) guaranteeing women the same rights as men in terms of access to ownership or control of land
This is to clarify that the country has a legal framework (including customary law) guaranteeing women the same rights as men in terms of access to ownership or control of land.
Affirmation on the existence of the legal framework or not
Not available
Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5.c Adopt well-designed policies and enforceable legislation to promote gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels and strengthen existing ones
5.c.1. Proportion of countries with systems to track and report on the amount of resources allocated to gender equality and women's empowerment
This involves affirming or denying the existence of systems to monitor and make public the amount of resources allocated to gender equality and the empowerment of women.
Not available
Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5.2 Eliminate from public and private life all forms of violence against women and girls, including trafficking and sexual exploitation and other types of exploitation
5.2.1 Proportion of women and girls aged 15 and over who have lived as a couple victims of physical or sexual violence during the previous 12 months
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
Head of Service and Focal Point
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
It is the ratio between women and girls aged 15 and over who have lived as a couple victims of physical or sexual violence during the previous 12 months and all women and girls aged 15 and over.
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator is relevant because it captures the situation of violence against women.
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.

Women and girls aged 15 and over who have lived in a relationship who have experienced physical or sexual violence in the past 12 months divided by the total of all women and girls aged 15 and over multiplied by 100.
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

5.a Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control of land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and resources natural, in compliance with internal legislation

5.a.1.Proportion of the total agricultural population with property rights or guaranteed rights to agricultural land, by sex; b) proportion of women among the holders of property rights or guaranteed rights over agricultural land, by type of right
It is the percentage of the agricultural population with property rights or guaranteed rights to agricultural land in relation to the total population according to the age group considered.
Agricultural population with property rights or guaranteed rights to agricultural land divided by the total population according to the age group considered, multiplied by 100.
Not available
